result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio D Caffey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 5/23/15 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Concurrent with: with any sentence. Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. Credit for 70 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio D Caffey

records.addlTxt: Bond paid on 20CF003524 was applied to costs due on 14CF000581.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41004207847198, arrest date 2-19-14, MCSD.

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Antonio D Caffey in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 70 days served; Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 5/23/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Antonio D Caffey in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. Defendant has two new charges.  Court vacates the warrant.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 8/12/2014 in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Summary report from JusticePoint received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has picked up a new case.  State will likely be moving to revoke the agreement.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms
Violation report from JusticePoint, received and filed. lms

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.    Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an AMENDED INFORMATION as to Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Retail Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.50(1m)(b) and (4)(a) , a class A  MISDEMEANOR.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  kmw
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense to find a monitoring agency.    DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 34.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/7/14.
css

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JCPENNEY'S (SOURTHRIDGE).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antonio D Caffey in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Antonio D Caffey in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
